H0.text: Where was the first permanent European settlement established in North America. Mexico

H1.text: Where was the first permanent European settlement established in North America. California

H2.text: Where was the first permanent European settlement established in North America. Newfoundland

H3.text: Where was the first permanent European settlement established in North America. Fla.

A4.text: Founded in 1565 by the Spanish conquistador Pedro Menéndez de Avilés, St. Augustine is the oldest continuously occupied settlement of European origin in the contiguous United States.
